property.name: APOE_Game_Form_Text_1_a
property.default: , you took the MindCrowd online memory quiz to advance our understanding of the brain..
property.label: APOE_Game_Form_Text_1_a

property.name: APOE_Game_Form_Text_2
property.default: We are inviting you to participate in more exciting MindCrowd research. This study involves a simple cheek swab that will be used to look at a specific gene, called apolipoprotein E (APOE), that is associated with Alzheimer’s disease. You’ll receive a report with the results of this analysis.
property.label: APOE_Game_Form_Text_2

property.name: APOE_Game_Form_Text_4
property.default: The APOE gene is associated with Alzheimer’s disease risk. There are three main forms of APOE, called APOE2, APOE3, and APOE4. Everyone has two of these, one inherited from each parent. You could have a combination of any two, or two of the same type. APOE4 is associated with a higher risk of developing late-onset Alzheimer’s disease, while APOE2 is associated with protection against developing the disease. [For more information, check out this great resource from the National Institutes of Health
property.label: APOE_Game_Form_Text_4

property.name: APOE_Game_Form_Text_5
property.default: The button below will take you to more information about the study and our online consent form. Once the consent is completed, we’ll send you a kit that you can use to take your cheek swab sample and a pre-paid envelope to send it to the laboratory.
property.label: APOE_Game_Form_Text_5

property.name: APOE_Game_Form_Text_6
property.default: YES, I want to learn more about this research Oportunity.
property.label: APOE_Game_Form_Text_6

property.name: APOE_Game_Form_Text_7
property.default: Thank you again for your willingness to help advance our understanding of the brain!.
property.label: APOE_Game_Form_Text_7
